intro: Struthanthus syringifolius var. longepedunculatus, commonly known as the long peduncled flaxflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, often in clusters at the ends of long, slender peduncles. Its leaves are alternate and typically have a heart-shaped base, with a hairy texture. This variety is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
